Reviews.Title: “quiet city center hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alessandro G
Reviews.Content: A small city center hotel near to the Empire State Building, half way between downtown and uptown and with the underground station just nearby. A very good breakfast included in the room price is waiting for you. ..................................................................................................................................................

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin ;)”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: Our room had ample space for our 5 day stay, the room service was above what was expected I.e changing of bed every day & general cleaning of room & bathroom. It was noise free & staff were very accommodating to any requests we had.... It was in the perfect location for all the main tourists attractions, subway was just a block away. The breakfast wasn't 5 star but was perfect to start the day in the big apple :) This was my third stay in new York, which I have stayed in more expensive bigger hotels but my advice is keep your money for shopping etc & stay at the clarion.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Maria_washington
Reviews.Content: It doesn´t promess more than it is. The hotel location was very good, walking distance to Times Square, The Empire State and Central Park and only a block away from the metro. The room was nice but small, the staff hepful and kind, the breakfast perfect to go out and walk a lot. If you are looking for a cheap and great located hotel is perfect for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Osakasenba
Reviews.Content: We needed two beds, but the staff gave us two only for a surcharge of 30 USD. Room we got was very spacious, but facing the Park Avenue. VERY noisy in evening, windows are absolutely not sound proof. Bathroom was generally OK, with a window on the fire escape stairs. BUT the glass was not obscure, so the whole bath room was clearly visible. My friend told me he heard somebody outside (drunk??), so we attached a towel to the window. Continental breakfast is OK. All and all, it seems to be a good, albeit rather faceless and unpretentious, option for NYC.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Dont Come Here”
Reviews.Author: Candace R
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed a night at the Clarion for a girls trip to the city before Christmas. Upon arriving, we called down to the front desk (on our cell phone because our room phone wouldn't work and then they accused of making international calls) to get some ice and set up the rollaway bed we had ordered. Juan Carlos brought us up some ice and left the roll away bed un set up. Before leaving, he told us it was "no big deal" because "no one was here". We called down on our cell phones again, realizing we didn't have a wine opener for our celebratory bottle of wine and needed some more ice (my friend hurt her ankle) and they then told us we'd have to go downstairs to open the wine/get ice. The room is very tiny, had about 1 foot walking space in between the bed, roll away bed we had to set up ourselves. When we went to turn on the tv, it had about 10 channels, only a few actually had volume. The room's temperature was unbearably hot, and the windows were not able to open up to get any fresh air in the room. None of the clarion staff members offered to help us turn the air conditioning off so we all had to sleep in our underwear. Also, you can't turn the light on in the bathroom without turning the fan on too so its impossible to communicate with anyone else. Luckily, there was no one else in the whole hotel so noise level wasn't a problem. The complimentary breakfast was an entirely different story. We went down about 9:30 to an odd assortment of hard bagels (unable to be sliced by a metal knife), gas station pastries, bagged orange and apple juice and coffee that tasted like dirt. There was a waffle maker there, but no waffle mix. My friend and I grabbed two of the hard bagels and attempted to slice through them while our other friend went to go ask the hotel manager where she could find the waffle mix. She returned with the hotel manager who yelled at her saying, "I make them"! He then came over to where my friend and i were attempting to slice our bagels and yelled at us "put them back" and grabbed our bagels and threw them back in the pin. He also yelled at us for using a tea plate instead of a plate by the waffle maker void of any waffles. This horrible man then yelled a few more things under his breath and went in some back room for a while only to return with two bags of bagels. Then, he put his dirty little hands all over our sesame bagels, took the bagel chopper liked it was a guillotine and slammed our bagels in half on the counter. Meanwhile, he attempted to make a waffle for my friend which wasn't cooked through and tasted horrible as well. We were very surprised when we saw another guest at breakfast - a grandma that looked like she'd taken too much valium - guess that's the kind of guest that the clarion looks to attract here. The hotel managed stood by and watched us like a hawk while we ate and then as we got up, muttered some things under his breath about us and yelled at my friend for not finishing her cup of their crap coffee. Overall staff was horrible, so unhelpful in recommending places to eat/go/sightsee and wouldn't so much as dare offer to call you a cab. I highly suggest NOT EVER booking a reservation at this abominable "hotel". It was a disgrace to see such inattentive or even friendly peoeple acting in such a wretched manner at their place of employment. I would be utterly surprised if this hotel booked more than 4 rooms a month at the very most.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Budget Traveller”
Reviews.Author: Brendon P
Reviews.Content: Once again another hotel that required a massive deposit even thou though they take a scan of your credit card at check-in. The room was small but very nice and had what you need when travelling. What do you expect for a cheap hotel in New-York. Thou in 2 places of my room, there was scurting missing on the roof and round the carept which was unusual and abit ugly. There was also a dodgey wall paper patch-up job done in the bathroom where is looks like a hole had been made. The rooms can get a bit hot with the central heating so you might need to use the air-conditioner. The air-conditioner works but makes a rattling/motor sound so you will not want it on for long anyway. The room was always made up nice and clean eevry day we came back and the staff were very friendly. Some were basic on their knowledge of where things were or how much a taxi would cost etc. All the staff wore different uniform from casual clothes, dress clothes to a clarion polo shirt so it could get a bit confusing to who you are askin for advice when all the uniforms are different. It was a good stay and would probably stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Central, but not value for money”
Reviews.Author: LondonMarylou
Reviews.Content: I think that this is the sort of hotel that visitors to NY "end up". It is very central and within spitting distance of a subway stop. And that is about it. My room was so small that if I had had 2 pieces of luggage, I would have had to jump to the bed from the door. Even in the middle of the day, you needed all available lights on. Getting in and out of the bathroom was a challenge as there was not really enough room for an open door and a person at the same time. And all this for $224 a night.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: pepette162
Reviews.Content: 1st visit to NYC -4 day Thanksgiving weekend - this wasn't my 1st hotel choice, but wasn't disappointed. For $200/night, I got a 12 ft x 12 ft room to include a 4 ft x 6 ft bathroom, twin bed, desk and nightstand and TV with HBO -danishes, bagels, cereal, fruit, coffee, juice available 7 am - 10 am in lobby. Small window in room overlooked brick wall, floors squeaked with every step, but room was clean, bed comfortable, and shower had plenty of hot water. The best part of this hotel is the location. Two minute walk to the left or right of the front door gets you to Lexington Ave #6 subway station which heads uptown and downtown (terminates at City Hall/Brooklyn Bridge). Easy walk from front door to Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Grand Central Station, 5th Ave shopping, Times Square, Broadway, - Midtown streets scenic and fun to walk around so I didn't use the subway as much as I thought I would. Plenty of places nearby to get take-out meals. All in all, as long as you are prepared for a cozy/claustrophobic room at Clarion Park Ave, you will have a great time in NYC. So much to see & do that you won't spend much time at the hotel, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Room with no view”
Reviews.Author: Ellen-Mine
Reviews.Content: A dark room with no view unless you want to look at airconditions or fire escapes. No fridge,- but in April you could place a bottle on the outside window sill. The room was small, but with places to put clothes etc.You could make coffee/tea in the room (if you had got supplies from the staff), clean room + bathroom, WiFi and tv. The staff was very helpful, but had problems when we were too many guests who wanted breakfast at the same time. Easy to get around in New York from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “return visit, even better”
Reviews.Author: melbguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value through and through. For under $200/night you can't ask for much in NYC, but this place fully satisfies. The location is excellent, it's clean, and the rooms have everything you need. No, it's not fancy, but it's cozy and best of all, it's affordable! I stayed here last year in a single room, and booked a full-size (double) this time, which is clearly a step above the singles. The bed is not that large so might be cramped for two people, but as a single traveler that obviously didn't bother me. I thought the front office staff was okay, no complaints. If their rates stay like this, I'll certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: cheadleblue
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positive - this is a very convenient midtown location, and the rooms are surprisingly quiet inside considering where you are - but I think for the price I paid (average $360 per night) you must be able to do better, even in New York. I think to some Park Avenue sounds very grand, like the Mayfair of New York, but in reality it's much the same as adjacent streets such as 5th Avenue, Madison, Lexington, 3rd etc. The negatives are rather numerous - cramped, smelly rooms, tiny bathroom where the plugs dont fit so you have to keep the taps running to have a bath, no catering other than a minimal (although free) breakfast. I dont think any of this would ruin a trip to New York but maybe suggest you use Trip Advisor to find alternatives that give you a little bit more in terms of atmosphere and/or quality.

Reviews.Title: “nyc”
Reviews.Author: amhamud m
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel, rooms are clean, the location perfect, the only bad thing was the girl at the reception,,,,never look at you when you talk to her.any question you ask her she look at the doorman..like she don't know nothing..i ask her for some restaurant to have dinner and she wait like 10 minute looking for the doorman to come and tell me..her name is Marellen....i think the housekeeper will do a better job a the front desk

Reviews.Title: “small rooms with a political agenda”
Reviews.Author: lonereignger
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a hotel in the USA where the politics of the franchisee controls what the hotel offers before i stayed here. The rooms are small and very dark as the windows are two feet from the building next door so it looks like midnight at noon in most of the rooms. The cable offerings are scant, and FoxNews network is not offered. When i asked why, i was told that it is because it is not fair to Muslims, and the internet access code was Sept 11 per the bearded ( and scary) front desk clerk. the hotel is clean but i can see why the rates are consistently lower than any others in a very high-rent part of Park Ave. And the Clarion on 23rd, which may not be run by the same franchisee, seems to never have Fox New network "working" when it supposedly is offered. and you have to be a very agile person to reach the air conditioner located at the top of the window standing on the bed. I'm over 6' tall and could barely reach the controls, and in a very dangerous reach where i'd go through the window if I slipped. I won't be coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “will return”
Reviews.Author: HAMILTONROUSE
Reviews.Content: Very good budget hotel in great location with very helpfull staff rooms are small but very clean

Reviews.Title: “No Matter What, not worth the Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sean S
Reviews.Content: Foul stench with AC running, Now I got a headache! Constant slamming of doors and creaking floors all throughout the night causing my second night of sleep deprivation! Ive stayed in hundreds of hotels! Some much less expensive, and have never been compelled to leave a comment! This is the First!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time staying here!”
Reviews.Author: LuvBloomies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed her for 3 nights, when we were visiting friends. While I agree this hotel is not the Waldorf Astoria.it is a decent hotel. And the price is very good if you book far enough in advance. This was our 2nd visit here, and we will continue to stay here when we are in town next.. It is a basic hotel, with a few extras. The hallways, rooms, and bathrooms are very small. But you have to remember this is is NYC. There are flat screen TV'S and free WIfi, and valet parking which is really nice. I found the bed to be rather comfortable and the linens and pillow good as well. The A/C does work, we had no problems. I would skip the breakfast and go across the street to Bread and Butter and get a real bagel and fresh fruit, or Starbucks. The people at the front desk are quite friendly, just show them them the same respect you would like to have yourselves. Unless you want to pay a fortune for more space and more amenities than this is just fine. Frankly I'd rather spend the extra money on good restaurants and shopping. That is why we come to New York right? I do agree that this hotel is not for small children. The rooms are too small to fit all the things that they need to have on a daily basis. And lastly the location is the best., you can walk all most everywhere, and if you can't walk the subway is right up the block. So, to summarize, If your looking for an affordable hotel, in a great location I highly recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: Larpool
Reviews.Content: If you like dirty small rooms with hardly functioning air conditioning and no safe , cracked sink , then this is the place for you . We checked out after one night having paid for two , that's how bad it was !

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LuvBloomies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are former New Yorkers who where in town visiting friends. We didn't want to spend a fortune on the hotel, and the Clarion was perfect. The rooms are very small, however they are very clean and our room was very quiet. I would skip the breakfast and go to a nearby deli, or diner. The location however can not be beat, lots of resturaunts close by, and the subway is a couple of blocks away. Offering parking to guests is a big plus. We will be staying here again the next time we are in town!

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: Bapu54
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst places I ever stayed. The rooms are extremly noisy, the room door doesn t close properly, you can hear a mouse walking along, they increased the hotel price and wouldn t not give the rate booked through "booking.com" (and booking. com says this issues is between the hotel and me-- the hotel has not responded to 4 of my e mails), don t stay there, don t book through bookig.com !

Reviews.Title: “I would avoid staying at ths hotel”
Reviews.Author: MDPMG
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to NY, her first trip to NY and stayed at the Clarion hotel in Park Ave, for 3 nights. From the reception, to the room, to the bathroom, to the breakfas,t to the valet parking, this hotel gets a negative score from me. First of all when we arrived, there was no doorman/bell man to take the bags from the car, and I asked the receptionist that I have a car and wanted to put it on valet parking. She gave me a white ticket with no information on it. Went into the room to find out the room was smaller than my apartment bathroom. The bathroom for this room was not even large enough to even take a shave. The toilet bowl had brown stuff all over it. Went to the bed to sleep the first night, and all the sheets smelled like smoke. Looked for an iron in the morning to iron my cloths.... No irons in the room. Had to call the front desk to get an iron Went to have breakfast in the morning. Pathetic.. They had one waffle iron for the entire hotel, some old bagels, croissants and a orange juice machine. Had to wait 15 mins to get a waffle ready. When we checked out, I got the car back, and there was a huge dent on the car. I am like what is this about? They claimed that it was there. Talked with the parking company and they showed me a white piece of paper claiming that there was a dent on the car. I could not believe it. When I unloaded the bags from the car, by myself, I did not see this dent, but they are claiming it was there when I parked. I will not recommend staying at this hotel for anyone. I would rather pay extra and stay closer to timesquare.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pardesi007
Reviews.Content: The Clarion Hotel Park Avenue couldn't be in a better location. There are tons of eateries withing a two block radius with easy access to most neighborhoods in Manhattan. I stayed in a single room (twin bed), which was fairly small; however, the amenities were very clean and new. I requested an iron, and within a few minutes it was already in my room. I only paid $125 for this hotel on a Thursday night and these are the things included: free continental breakfast, free newspaper, bellman reserved taxis for me wherever I was going, and bellman held my luggage at the hotel during my meetings. Excellent and friendly service. Couldn't believe I got such a deal in the heart of the City!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Room for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MaineFrank
Reviews.Content: From the front desk staff to the man overseeing the breakfast cafe everyone that I dealt with was professional and friendly. The location is convenient and near subway stops. My room was small but roomy compared to other NY hotels, clean and comfortable. The bed and linens were great. The LCD on the wall was a nice touch and overall I felt very comfortable when in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: melbguy
Reviews.Content: This place was far better than I had feared. Given some of the previous reviews, I was mentally prepared for a near-dump. Not at all. Yes, it's simple and a bit basic but it has everything you need: a room, a bed, a closet, a clean, decent-size bathroom with the usual soap / lotion / shampoo, very reliable wireless internet, and even a free breakfast. None of its features are anything to write home about: the rooms are small and some look right at the wall of the adjacent building, the breakfast is simple and the coffee isn't great, and some rooms don't even have an in-room safe. But you're not likely to spend a lot of time in your room, there's a Starbucks across the street for good coffee, which you can then combine with the hotel's bagels and freshly made waffles, and if you need to store valuables, they have safety deposit boxes downstairs. The location is very good, right on Park Ave, 2 min walk from the 6 train, and lots of restaurants of all kinds and price ranges within a 5 minute walk. This place is excellent value for NYC, where it's a significant challenge to find a room for under $200 per night. I'm glad I booked there, and I recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: marybbloom
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in Clarion Park Hotel and enjoyed our stay. We had a nice comfortable room with windows to the avenue. We enjoyed having free WIFI in our room and also the location was very convenient right in the center of Midtown. The continental breakfast was nice and the staff was very friendly and helpful. They even helped us finding a taxi which was not such an easy task considering all our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller than I could have imagined”
Reviews.Author: AmyPK
Reviews.Content: Wow--small is an understatement. I am a frequent NYC business traveler and have stayed in many NYC hotels. This is so small that the only place to open your suitcase is the bed. I wondered at first where I would even have room to iron (absolutely no floor space) and then realized that there was no iron/ironing board, so it was a moot point. I went to work seriously wrinkled. There is not even any place in the bathroom to set your tolietries. There is a tiny shelf about 4 inches wide. I had to set them down on the floor and grab things out as I needed them. Also, very poor insulation. Can hear everything outside your room. No exaggeration, I would estimate this room to be about 9x10 plus a tiny bathroom. Only plus- it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all the little whiny reviews”
Reviews.Author: KatieMo1
Reviews.Content: Ok is this place the Ritz Carlton? Absolutely not. If you keep that in mind when booking you will be just fine. The rooms very small because its NEW YORK CITY. Honestly, its clean, in a convenient location, has been newly renovated and its cheap. Reviews like the ones I've read about this place make it hard to trust TripAdvisor because many people on her have champagne taste on a beer budget. To all the negative reviewers: Stop whining and pay the extra hundred bucks and get the hotel you want!

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE - PRICY, GREEDY AND RUDE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: ManagerQuality
Reviews.Content: So many things are wrong at this hotel, its not funny. The night shift guy (I wont quality him as manager or remotely professional for that job) was rude, disinterested in talking to the guests, and very slow. Should give him a different role. We waited 20 minutes to be checked in, when we were the only ones waiting. Not sure what he was typing and talking on the phone with someone. Then we waited 30 minutes for car to be picked up by valet, and next day almost 1 hour for it to be delivered back to us. The morning staff was very helpful and knew what they had to do. The night guy needs to go. Then the rooms were so small that $250/night is ridiculous. Better off staying at the Y for $50/night. The internet was also to be paid by guests. All in all, I will stay away from this hotel. DO NOT RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Hotel Room EVER”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoChik77
Reviews.Content: Holy Cow, was not expecting to be put in a closet and charged for a regular room! Smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in! I understand that staying in NYC is definitely different than staying in other cities, but geez, when I opened the door to my room, I almost cried it was so small, and dark. It was located at the very end of the hallway, not sure what floor. I've been to Tokyo and see small, but this tops it all! At least the bathroom was clean. Would pay $50/nt for this place, not $130.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: lumpasaurousrex
Reviews.Content: Nice spacious double room, helpful staff and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Don´t go there unless you expect a hostel”
Reviews.Author: mhighstreet
Reviews.Content: Instead of airconditioning there was a gaping hole under the window. It was covered with a lid through which air and noise was freely coming in. Personnel brought an AC for the hole but probably another guest now had my problem... -Very small room, no desk to work. -Worn out interior. -One elevator for all guests and personnel. -Check out took 20 mins I checked out without sleeping there. If you look for a budget hotel, it might be acceptable, but for business trips look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clarion Small but Comfortable & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sheilaCO
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 502 of this hotel for five days in September. The rooms are small but they are clean. The bathroom had been recently redone. This room reminded me of the typical room in a European hotel, and most of the people staying there were Europeans. Our room faced the street but we heard little of the bustling traffic. This hotel is a short walk to the #6 subway line, which is a major line to take you all the way from Battery Park in the south to Harlem in the north. You can catch the #6 to Grand Central station two stops away. The only thing I thought could be improved was the breakfast. They had a waffle maker, but pastries were pre-packaged, the room is very small and can be congested. Coffee was good and yogurt available.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Newlywed0825
Reviews.Content: We had a really great time at this hotel. The staff was very friendly. The hotel was nice and in a great location. There was free breakfast downstairs which is a HUGE plus in NY City. The hotel room was pretty small, but hey, what do you expect, it's NY City! It was perfect for what we needed it for though, somewhere to keep our stuff and to sleep! The only downside I would say was that the bathroom was really dingy and could definitely use some upgrading. The location was fantastic...lots of great restaurants and bars within walking distance. We took it upon ourselves to walk to SoHo which is about 20 blocks, but you see so many neat things on the way. There are definitely places like Central Park and the Theatre district that you'd need to take a cab to from this hotel. We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler260
Reviews.Content: The location is great: 2 subway stops both less than 3 blocks away. There are coffee shops and restaurants in abundance around the hotel. The hotel room itself was very clean and comfortable, though yes, it is a lot smaller than what typical American hotel rooms are like. This hotel is small and remniscient of a European hotel. However, you're in New York City so you're not supposed to be spending a lot of time in your hotel room. The staff was very helpful. There was not an in-room iron, but we asked and one was delivered to our room immediately. We also left our bags after check-out and they were securely stored so that we could retrieve them later in the day and continue sightseeing without the hassle of our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Utmost Unprofessional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NguyenNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: Where can I start..... from a manager to a manager or should I say from a business owner to a business owner point of view... Timothy the manger/owner of Clarion Hotel on Park Ave (NY222) ran the hotel at the utmost unprofessional way of doing business. He lets greed get in the way to make his decision instead of providing the service that a guest is entitled to. I had made a reservation at this property for 2 nights. Traveling from New Orleans, Louisiana my flight had cancel in Detriot, Michigan due to a thunderstorm in New York. The only flight out was the next evening at 5PM, so instead of wasting a whole day of travel I reneted a car to drive to New York (a long 9 hours). In the mist of all this I had called the hotel to try to cancel my reservation, which I was refused by the hotel that they are not able to cancel my reservation. I explained my situation to the hotel and was told that unless I have document to show that my flight has been cancel then they will not charge my credit card for the first night ( which they did anyway). Before arriving into New York I had called the hotel again to confirmed my reservation and was told that everything was ok for an early check in. Few hours later arriving at the hotel to come to find out that they gave my room to another guest that paid twice as much as my rate. The hotel had over sold their rooms, so instead of finding a room for me at a near by location Timothy just simply told me "you have no reservation here". By then I was very tired and didnt really cared how much a room will cost me at that point in time, so I sat in the hotel lobby for an hour looking for another hotel anywhere nearby. By then Timothy was able to get me into a room with one bed in his hotel (which I am very greatful for at the time being) Because I was traveling with a friend and our room reservation was originally for 2 beds we settled for a room with one bed,(the room is very very small) but requested for a rollaway bed which was never delivered. At check in point I gave my document showing that my flight has been cancel, Timothy took the document and didnt return it. During check out time I had asked about the charges for the first night stay and the desk agent confirmed with me that the charges was adjusted back onto my credit card. Two weeks later my statement still showed the charges on my account so I called Timothy to question about my billing. This time Timothy said the document that I rendered was not enough proof I need to get a second document of proof in order for me to get my charges adjust back into my account. At this point in time its not about the money anymore its about the principle... this owner/manager over sold his rooms which is clearly the hotel problem not mines, but turn it out to be my problem. So instead of being sympathies about the situation that the hotel had caused, the manager decided not to resolved the issue. I would never ever refer this hotel to anyone and I will make sure that I let everyone know how badly this hotel mistreat people here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: ktskane
Reviews.Content: The Clarion was a great value and had nice sized rooms.The staff was very cordial, and accommadating to our needs. The hotel, though older was clean, and in a great location for visiting our daughter in Murray Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time in NY”
Reviews.Author: Montreal-chica
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in NYC and I work in a hotel as well. I had a really cheap rate and I loved the location! It was perfect! Everything is close to the hotel. Fifth Ave, Empire State, Central Park, everything is under a 20-minute walk! We had really good maid service and the front desk was very friendly. The free breakfast was much appreciated and very good I must say! The rooms are small but we only used it to sleep so it was perfect! Great stay overall!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but convenient”
Reviews.Author: barrymacm
Reviews.Content: Paid a last minute visit to NYC recently. Found great rate online. Hotel is very basic but don't forget, it is only a 2* hotel. Room was extremely small but paid a very low rate for the location and it was very clean. Staff were friendly. Check in was fast. Bed was ridiculously soft (not in a good way). Sank right in.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: karahbella
Reviews.Content: So you read these reviews before going and staying at the hotel, so nothing that I write will tell you anything new. Yes, small rooms and bathrooms. But you are in New York City! Enjoy what you're there for! You're not SUPPOSED to spend enough time in your room that there should be any issue! My husband and I visited New York for Valentine's Day and Clarion Park Ave worked perfectly for us. We stayed 3 nights. The bed was comfy, the breakfast was fine, the location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: Andreassn
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to say that this hotel has the most unfriendly front desk staff. Not at all service minded and it seems that they are just there to get paid.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Sockiegirl
Reviews.Content: My 15yr old daughter and I stayed at the Clarion Park Ave South Dec 13th for 1 night. We arrived in the city by bus (a trip to see the Christmas Show) and were dropped off near Bryant Park at 9:30am. We proceeded to start to walk toward the hotel to drop off our bags. It didn't seem that far on a map. Well after walking a few blocks in the cold we hailed a cab. I so glad we did as it was quite a ways away. Cab was $5 or $6. Our room was not available but we could check our bags and have breakfast (waffles, bagels,muffins, cereals, coffee and juices) which is included, then headed back out on the town. We took a cab back over to Times Square to walk around before the show. Cab was $8. Went to the Christmas Show at Radio City Music Hall and it was great! After the show we went to lunch with a friend and her 6yr old son at Mars 2112. This restaurant was cute. You ride a spaceship to Mars then get seated at a table in the middle of rock walls, martians dancing around and and waiter dressed up in a Star Trek type outfit. The food came out extremely fast and was good. We started heading back towards the hotel to check in and did some shopping with the street vendors around Rockefeller Plaza. It was extremely packed so we didnt even try to get over near the tree or skating rink. We checked into the hotel around 3:30pm and were given room 303. I thought the room was good size for NYC. There was a dresser, desk, Queen size bed, big flat screen tv, good size closet and decent size bathroom. All I wanted was a clean place to stay. Was the hotel a little worn down? Maybe, but the bed was very comfortable with nic ethick bedding and the bathroom was spotless. Our room was facing a brick wall, but it was very quiet and we slept very well. That is pretty much all you are in your room for anyway. My only complaint is you could smell a hint of cigarette smoke from previous guests. After check in we went over to the West Village to visit my Aunt. What an upcoming area of NYC. She told us it used to be the meat packing district and they are renovating all of the buildings to either be condos, stores or studios. Lots of neat little shops and restaurants. We went to dinner at Chelsea Restorante. A restaurant my Aunt have been going to for 25 years. It was authentic Italian. Awesome food and the service was the best! After dinner back to the hotel (cab $12) and straight to bed. The next morning I went down to the breakfast area and grabbed a coffee, juice and a couple of muffins to bring up the room. There is a sign that says this is not allowed, but the waiter let me as long as I brought the coffee cup back. I thought that was a little weird, so I brought the cup back down with me. Checkout was fine. I found the front desk staff very friendly but I didn't really need anything from them either. We took a cab back over to my aunt's home and went shopping in Chelsea Market before our train trip out of Penn station home. I put the prices of the cabs in my review because I chose this hotel because of the price and the name. It was little far from the places I was visiting. So maybe next time I will spend an extra $50 to $75 and stay closer to the sightseeing areas.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Hotel Room Outside of Europe”
Reviews.Author: ardmoreflyer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Clarion Hotel Park Avenue on Friday and Saturday of Thanksgiving Weekend. It was by far the best deal around at $161/night for a room with one double bed. Most other hotels were charging double that price. We typically like to stay in Murray Hill, Gramercy, Kip's Bay, because it's convenient to Penn Station, the 6 subway train, and easy access to the Village and Midtown. The Clarion, while pretty much average in every way did the job despite it being one of the smallest hotel rooms we've ever had outside of traveling in Europe. However, the room was fairly clean and updated and they managed to pack a lot of amenities into such a tiny space. The best feature was the large flat-screen tv in the room. We could pull it out and lay on the bed and it was almost at our feet. The bathroom was updated though it had one of the smallest tubs that I had ever seen. We didn't have any view, except of a fire escape between two buildings that was covered in pigeon dirt. However, we enjoyed the short stay there and the staff was courteous. I would likely not stay there again if I had the choice of larger rooms elsewhere, but like I said, for the price on a holiday weekend, you couldn't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Clarion Park Avenue”
Reviews.Content: Was booked here on a business trip. Worst hotel I have stayed in years. Tiny rooms and bathroom. No internet service when I was there. Room reeked of a putrid disinfectant smell.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs Room 408”
Reviews.Author: callt
Reviews.Content: I don't know if the hotel has a pervasive bed bug problem or if it was an isolated incident, but I stayed in Room 408 (a single twin room) and there were bed bugs. I spoke with the manager on duty who didn't seem to be too surprised or overly concerned. I don't know if they did anything about it, so I would be aware of it if you stay here. Otherwise, everything people have said about this hotel is true. Small dark rooms with small bathroom, great location with subway less than two blocks away, Starbucks across the street, slow elevators, staff is not rude but not overly concerned with your comfort, good air conditioning. If it wasn't for the bed bugs, I would have probably given this hotel an average rating because I was expecting all of those things I mentioned above - except for the bugs.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Vicki
Reviews.Content: The Clarion on Park Avenue South is a small, older hotel that you can get for cheap (paid $189/night). When I stayed there, they were replacing the furniture in all the rooms, which meant that the already very small lobby was filled to the ceiling with nightstands and headboards, making it impossible to sit in the lobby and enjoy their free wifi. The afternoon I checked in (at 3:15; the sign at the lobby said check in was any time after 3) I was told my room was getting new furniture and to come back in an hour. No apologies, and the clerk was did not seem the least bit concerned that I would be put out by this. I made a fuss at the desk, and within a few minutes was checked in. (funny thing, the next morning, the sign behind the desk showed that check in was 5pm) Room had very old furniture, carpet was worn, and the bathroom was really tiny. I don't even think the tub was full sized. Plusses were: flat screen tv, and a/c worked really well, centrally located, near the subway. For $189, it's okay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: Darrin B
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to visit during the July 4th weekend this year, and my travel partner and I stayed at the Clarion Park Av S for the two nights we were in town. Plusses: - Helpful and friendly staff. - Bathroom was immaculate. - COMFY bed. Very nice pillows. Summertime included a duvet cover if you like to have one over you with the air conditioning on. - A short (5 block) walk to the M16 bus that will take you to either the Port Authority Bus Terminal or Penn Station. - Excellent air conditioning controlled by boarders. - Decent breakfast bar located near the rear of the first floor (excellent for those that don't really have time for a sit-down restaurant, or don't feel like McDonalds). - Near (one block from) the 28th Street subway station (6 line) that will whisk you down to 14th Street/Union Square (Greenwich Village). - Safe and quiet street after hours. Negatives: - Room was tiny, but how long do you actually spend in a hotel room if you're sightseers? Luggage had to sit on the floor next to the desk since there isn't really room for a luggage rack.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for us!”
Reviews.Author: isidella
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend getaway with my significant other. Sure the room was small (but if you are in NYC you should probably not spend too much time inside anyways) and our window looked onto a brick wall, but the room was clean and the bed linens were amazingly soft! The flat screen TV was a nice touch. The front desk staff was helpful. Very close to 28th street station and Les Halles Restaurant. Good neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “clean enough but claustophobic”
Reviews.Author: Acrostic
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for 3 nights on business and would prefer not to stay again if it can be avoided. There is nothing horribly wrong except the size of the room. I had a single room with a twin bed. As another review mentioned, there is very little room for any luggage and the room is so small that the small desk and chair compete with the bathroom door. I am not a tall person and I felt uncomfortably crowded in the small shower stall. I would absolutely not recommend a twin bed room in this hotel to most men and anyone over 5'5" tall. The bed was not too comfortable and had one sad, uncomfy pillow. I only stopped in the breakfast room once to get a drink and what I saw looked sad, like convenience store rejects. Now for the good points: the staff were fairly prompt, courteous and helpful (something you can't say for many hotels supposedly better than this), the room was quite clean, the location is safe and convenient - 1 block to the 6 train, starbucks across the street and many good restaurants around, the internet is included and always worked perfectly, tv was good, the place was quiet .

Reviews.Title: “Almost uniformly horrible. Consider sleeping outside before staying here.”
Reviews.Author: frpsct
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, this hotel could not make a non-smoking room available, despite that having been specified in the reservation. The room I was forced to endure not only reeked of cigarette smoke that I spent two days with the window open, but was so small that I literally had to turn sideways to go into the bathroom. I wouldn't stay here again if they paid me.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and Central, but far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: DG55
Reviews.Content: New York City has to be the most difficult place I've encountered to find a good quality reasonably priced hotel aside from London. Everything on Manhattan seems to be expensive, so you will have to shell out a bit. In the end we booked the Clarion because a friend was staying there, because lets face it - it doesn't have the best Trip Advisor ranking! The hotel is small, in Manhattan terms, sandwiched between two larger buildings, it is almost misplaced on Park Avenue. Its almost slightly homely as you walk in, a small reception area and one small lift which serves the 8 (or so) floors. It is extremely central, close to the empire state building, with a metro on the same block, and 15 minutes walk from Times Square. The rooms are similar, very small - although probably to be expected whilst staying in such a heavily populated and expensive area. They've just about managed to squeeze a double bed in, and a small desk and chair which occupies space contested with the door, you'll need to squeeze by if the someone is using the desk. The desk also hosts the coffee making equipment and a lamp, you can barely fit a laptop on there - but its worth the squeeze, as you get free WiFi in this hotel. The bathroom is equally small, with a small (half) sized bath with shower attachment. The best thing about the rooms, is the fantastic 40" Sony LCD television (you'll get a slightly smaller one in the single rooms), which is a great after a long day walking about the city. There are a few things which annoyed us. Firstly the heating, which seemed to be turned up full whack on our first few days - it was almost unbearable. We had to have the air conditioning occasionally, which is ridiculous in winter! The air conditioning is essentially useless, its loud and ineffective - so in summer (and winter it seems!) you'll be baking at night unless you dont mind the loud fans whirling. The other thing, was the view from the window. Possibly the worst I've ever encountered, you get a view of the dirty brickwork of the building next door, about 4 feet away - so you get hardly any sunlight through there. You'll also notice a fire exit stairway decorated with bird poop, and if you're lucky - a couple of pigeons sitting on your window going "coo, coo, coo"! Fantastic! You wont want to open your window here. You get a free breakfast on the ground floor every morning, which isn't great but it does the trick if you want to save a bit more money. They have some packaged pastries, bagels and bread, cereal, and fresh waffles. Elsewhere, there is a 24 hour McDonalds just outside the hotel to your left which can be useful. As I said though, it is reasonably priced. We paid around £450 ($900) for 6 nights, taking advantage of a 15% discount when booking 3 nights in a row on crshotels.com. Overall, considering the prices of New York, this isn't actually too bad, the location is good, but the hotel itself is a bit of a compromise. The price is reasonable, and what you get is mostly good, but there are just a few things that let it down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for New York”
Reviews.Author: HokieTimo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights at the Clarion. Very convenient to the subway. First time we've stayed away from Times Square and it was a nice break from the crowds.Room was large by New York standards and the bathroom very nice. Continental breakfast was ok.Would have been better had the attendant kept the breakfast stocked better instead of continuously running to the back for something that had run out.Seemed to be doing it on purpose so he could get a tip.Starbucks across the street.Nice restaurant nearby on 27th st-Blue Smoke-BBQ and Jazz.Will stay again. Paid $161 with AAA rate for 2 dbl beds

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: jhoward319
Reviews.Content: Our room was huge compared to what we expected (Room 201 I think - 2 double beds, at the front of the hotel), staff was very friendly. Elevator and hallways were tiny, but that's New York. Close to several subway lines. Felt safe. Much better than expected, would recommend to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Papaya9
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel for the price (~$160US). Not posh nor is it a dump, but very small. Front desk guys were very nice and as accommodating as possible. Room was tiny, but it had a flatscreen TV and a decent shower, and it was CLEAN! We stayed on a lower floor and could mildly hear a live band playing up until midnight..acceptable! We also could hear the poor pigeons quietly cooing outside..they must have been freezing! The only hitch about our time here was that the valet/parking company that contracts with the clarion were either unorganized or understaffed. Took a good 45 minutes to get the car back. You're better off parking it yourself so you can get it pronto. All in all, it was a cute little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: debs1959
Reviews.Content: very clean, the staff are very helpful the complmentry continental breakfast was very nice,the rooms were fairly small but clean and comfftable bathrooms are onsuite also small but always lovely and clean the hotel is on park ave in manhatten it is very near to macys and times square .its about 25 mins walk to bloomingdales and centrel park.if you want to get to ground zero you will need to get a yellow cab this is about $10.i would recommened this hotel to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: rochester_NYScoutmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding. You cannot beat the price or the location. One block north of the the subway. I booked 3 rooms for my Girl Scout Troop & each room was clean and spacious (we had the rooms with the 2 double beds). The halls are small & the elevator is small but the stairs are easily accessable. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. I have stayed at the Embassy Suites and the beds here were much more comfy! The staff was outstanding and extremely helpful. I can't wait to come back with my husband & kids!

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities but management is a bit offputting”
Reviews.Author: Wazdoggy
Reviews.Content: We chose the Clarion because the rooms were refurbished and new, which was a pleasant change from many hotels we looked at in the same price range. The rooms are very small, but who wants to spend too much time in their hotel room in New York. If you only need a place to stay, the room size is not a problem. The bathroom was also new and very good. The breakfast was also great by comparison to other hotels, with cereal, fresh bread and bagels, fruit and fresh made waffles. The downside was the rather pushy management, who seemed to just tell you anything to apease you, and were not so open to being asked questions or queries about the booking or rooms. We booked a no smoking room but our room always smelled of smoke when we got back into it at the end of the day, and there was no room safe even though everything we looked at said there was. When we asked management they seemed surprised there wasnt one, however they clearly knew that was the case. When we asked to leave our passports and valuables in their own safe they simply said we should leave it in our room, it would be fine. Overall, Id stay there again if the price was right as the facilities are small but very good. Management is the only thing that would put me off.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small but clean room”
Reviews.Author: tj171717
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in several other reviews, the rooms at this hotel are small, but that's fairly typical for NYC. The real surprise is the size of the halls: stepping off the tiny elevator, you can't take but half a step or you'll run into the wall. That said, you don't spend your time in the halls, but it's a little disconcerting. Based on the fire evacuation route map on the back of the door, it appears that the rooms 01, 02 and 05 on each floor are the largest so keep that in mind while booking. The bathroom was small with a miniature tub/shower, pedestal sink and nothing but a tiny glass shelf for toiletries but it was kept spotlessly clean by the staff. There was barely room to set a suitcase in the room and that was only on the floor. There was a small wardrobe with some hanging space and a couple of shelves. The desk had a hanging light over it and several extra outlets which was a nice touch. The flat screen tv was mounted on the wall but had very few channels to choose from. The air conditioner was mounted at the top of one window but the controls could be reached and it didn't block the view. The carpet was a bit dingy and the baseboards needed cleaning but overall it was clean. The queen size bed was fairly comfortable (no pillow top mattress) but the pillows were quite tiny and thin. The towels, although small, were very new and thick. Although I had requested a non-smoking room, the hotel said they could not provide one. I believe this was because the rate was a business negotiated rate and lower than their regular rates. They were saving those non-smoking rooms for higher paying customers. This was the only slight I felt during our stay. The staff was quite nice and friendly. We did not take advantage of the continental breakfast because it consisted only of coffee, juice and some prepackaged muffins. When I'm in NY, I want to take advantage of the opportunity for something better than convenience store food. The breakfast area seemed to be set up for eating in rather than taking something with you as I only saw coffee cups & saucers rather than disposable cups. There was a tip jar very conspicuously located for the lady who was keeping coffee cups filled. There are at least a dozen places for a quick breakfast within 2 blocks including a Starbucks directly across Park Ave. and a Dunkin Donuts a few steps north. For $5 you can get something besides cellophane covered muffins. You can't beat the area this hotel is in. It's easy walking distance to some excellent restaurants, Madison Sq. Park and lots more. It's a very safe place to be and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location so-so, awful staff!”
Reviews.Author: ASSDO
Reviews.Content: Not bad location, but I´ve been much better located in NY for less than the USD180/day paid here. I´ve only accepted this hotel because I booked my trip a few days earlier, so the hotels I like were all booked already. Small room but OK, except for the heat so hot that we had to turn the a/c on, and also cleaning could be improved. My travel agent never send my credit card information to the hotel as she booked it via some system that does not require credit card numbers - I was not aware of that. So the front desk staff kept annoying me, asking how I intended to pay for the stay. Every time I left or arrived with shopping bags they would tell me to be careful otherwise I would not have money to pay for the stay... Awful and unpolite! If they had told me at check-in that they did not have my credit card number, I would kindly have given it to them and would have been spared from all the embarassing comments. I understand the situation was not their fault, but the lack of assertive communication was their fault indeed. Months later, travel agent called me to ask for my credit card receipt as the hotel was refusing to pay the due commission to her, saying I have never been there. So they were the swindlers after all!!! They never paid her commission. I would not go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: cle_traveller_30
Reviews.Content: It is a good place to stay. Rooms are tiny but very clean though. You cant expect bigger room than this in new york for the price you pay. My stay was pleasant and the staff were friendly. Location is also great! I'll definitely recommend this place if you want to stay in a decent, and clean place but you dont want to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Marie_Grazielle
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews before staying at the hotel, I was scared! But it was fine. Yes the rooms are small but clean. If you want a big room and good service dont stay here! The location is perfect. You get for what you pay for. The breakfast was good. ok no buffet, but you could have your toast and coffee, cereals and yogurt. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: purennyl
Reviews.Content: The room we had was small, we could barely cross the room bacause of the small space between the bed and the TV. The toilet is actually one of the best that I've experienced, but then again, I always travel on low budget hotels... There was a clanging noise in the room constantly, which was quite annoying the first couple of nights, but you kinda get use to it (we were there for two weeks). The location of this hotel is really great, well it was actually perfect for me and my friend. Right in the middle, a few blocks away from 5th avenue! Really close to Empire State Building. When we came back, the rome was always clean, new towels and everything. Our cleaning ladies always watch TV while they clean, but hey, as long as they get the job done, then whats the harm? Altogether I think that its a okay hotel, it especially wins BIG points on its location. If I ever where to go to N.Y.C. ever again, I would consinder using Clarion Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk”
Reviews.Author: michelelasker
Reviews.Content: This is a place that should be taken off the list. When we checked in the hallways were littered with broken tvs and old mattresses. The walls in the rooms were warped, there was no room to walk around the bed, and no place to store clothes. Enough said. Date of Almost stay: Jan. 31, 2007

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: missD07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good value for money considering its central location. However, the rooms are very small and the heating did not work in our room so it can get quite cold. Also one day the cleaner had left our door unlocked, which we told the hotel about. It didn't happen again but we had no response from the manager. Really nice breakfast and most of the staff are helpful. I would recommend it as an affordable option with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “OK!!!! The price it is right”
Reviews.Author: mainard
Reviews.Content: Good ratio between price (about 100 dollars per night in the christmas time) and service!!!! Room and bathroom tiny but clean. The service was good and the breakfast was adequate. The check in girl was asleep but nice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Pontius
Reviews.Content: The lesson that I learned this NY trip - pay more for comfort! What a cheap hotel! Room was very small, cold and no sound proof. Elevator was out of order. The clerk named Cynthia was very unfriendly and unprofessional. I asked her to book me a limo to the airport on the day I was coming back emphasizing that I was gonna pay in credit, but the driver asked me cash at the airport saying that he had not been informed anything from that lady! A cheap hotel like this could be a nightmare and ruin your New York trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in great location - perfect for marathonrunners (like us)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Clarion Hotel during our stay in New York (where we were to participate in the marathon). The location is absolutely terrific, the rooms are nice but small and the deal we had included breakfast, which was simple but ok. The only thing we didn't like about the hotel was SOME of the staff........ I don''t think they where unfriendly, they were just plain stupid. If I ever go to NY again (and I definetely will) I will absolutely think about staying in the Clarion again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, functional, budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: gooeyduq
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel through a Priceline deal. The rooms and hallways are small (on par with European hotels) but for New York City and for its price it's generally a good deal. You shouldn't be spending much time in your hotel anyways if you're in Manhattan--there are much better things to do. There is free (unsecured, of course) wireless Internet available in the rooms which is nice. It is conveniently very close to the number 6 subway which can whisk you up or downtown very quickly. A couple of less desirable points: our bathroom tub drained quite poorly and the shower didn't work so well; our window faced the back (looking out into a 4-foot wide alleyway between brick buildings) and pigeons were roosting over our AC unit making for occasionally noisy mornings; and the continental breakfast, while free (such a luxury in New York), was really quite mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Buffalo_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently visited NYC with my family for three days and stayed at this hotel. I can't say enough about how pleased we were with both the hotel and the service. Everyone was friendly and went out of their way to help us whenever asked (restaurants, directions, with luggage, getting a cab, etc.) The rooms were very large, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was large and clean as well. (The hallways are somewhat narrow, but not as narrow as some other NYC hotels.) The free continental breakfast was good - my only complaint is that there could have been more fruit. The neighborhood is great and convenient to all of NYC (almost smack dab in the middle of things). There is a subway station about a block away (I believe for the number 6 train, going uptown and downtown.) Bottom line is that I will definitely stay here on my next trip and have no qualms about recommending it to anyone else. Our rooms were $179 (weeknight) and $197 (weekend), which is quite reasonable for a convenient, safe, clean room in the city. I have stayed many other places here, and dollar for dollar, this is among the best in value.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at better hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: NoahTrop
Reviews.Content: This was probably worst hotel I've stayed in. I live in NJ and stayed in NYC only because I had a meeting early in the morning. With that in mind, I expected a normal night sleep. My room was about 85 degrees and i could not figure out how to turn off the radiator - yes radiator - so I turned on the A.C. Unit. This thing was louder than the loudest setting on the TV!! Then there was the noise in the hallway at 4AM. Then the radiator started making the most obnoxious sounds. Clanking and Banging. Needless to say I did not sleep one wink. Its worth noting that the room was the size of the bed but what do you expect for $100 in New York City. I'll tell you what I expect, and that's a good night sleep. I skipped the breakfast and shot out of there in a New York Minute.

HotelInfo.Name: Clarion Hotel Park Avenue
HotelInfo.Address: 429 Park Avenue South, New York City, NY 10016
